meanings.definition: The object of a person's ambition or effort.
meanings.sent1: Her main goal is to become a teacher.
meanings.sent2: His goal is to save enough money for a new bike.
meanings.sent3: Trying to eat all the cookies in one sitting is not a very achievable goal.
meanings.sent4: Reaching for the stars, her goal was to make a difference in the world.
meanings.sent5: The goal of winning the science fair motivated him to work hard on his project.

meanings.definition: The result or achievement toward which effort is directed.
meanings.sent1: After weeks of practice, her goal of running a mile was finally achieved.
meanings.sent2: The team celebrated reaching their goal of winning the championship.
meanings.sent3: His goal of finishing all his homework in five minutes seemed impossible.
meanings.sent4: The goal of finding a cure for cancer drives many scientists in their research.
meanings.sent5: The ultimate goal of the experiment was to prove the theory correct.

meanings.sent1: The soccer player kicked the ball into the net, scoring a goal.
meanings.sent2: The basketball team cheered as they made another goal.
meanings.sent3: In a game of hockey, the penguin scored a goal against the polar bear team.
meanings.sent4: The crowd erupted in cheers as the home team scored the winning goal.
meanings.sent5: Scoring a goal in the final seconds of the match, she secured the victory for her team.
